alert.note: Alert for Eastern Uinta Basin; Eastern Uinta Mountains (Utah) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS GrandJunction (Western Colorado and Eastern Utah)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued March 05 at 10:33AM MST by NWS GrandJunction
info.description: ...A BAND OF HEAVY SNOW WILL AFFECT PARTS OF LOWER YAMPA RIVER BASIN...EASTERN UINTA BASIN...AND EASTERN UINTA MOUNTAINS... HAZARDS...A band of heavy snow which can rapidly reduce visibility to less than a quarter of a mile. LOCATION AND MOVEMENT...At 1033 AM MST, a band of heavy snow was along a line extending from 17 miles north of Dinosaur to 19 miles south of Vernal and moving east at 15 MPH. LOCATIONS IMPACTED... This band of heavy snow will remain over mainly rural areas of west central Lower Yampa River Basin, east central Eastern Uinta Basin and southeastern Eastern Uinta Mountains. This includes the following highways... U.S. Highway 40 in Colorado between mile markers 1 and 4. U.S. Highway 40 in Utah between mile markers 162 and 174. Colorado 64 near mile marker 1. Colorado 318 near mile marker 37. SAFETY INFO... Use extra caution if you must travel into or through this band of heavy snow. Rapid changes in visibility and potentially slick roads may lead to accidents. &&

area.areaDesc: Eastern Uinta Basin; Eastern Uinta Mountains
